habitat: Under coast liveoak, oaks, ornamental hardwoods, summer to mid-winter, Europe, North America, Asia.
shortDescription: Poisonous mushroom with greenish-yellow cap, white gills, white stem with ring and volva, contains amatoxins causing liver failure.
benefitsOrToxicity: Amatoxins cause abdominal pain, vomiting, diarrhea, then liver failure, death if untreated.

identification.cap: 4-16 cm, round to flat, sticky when wet, dull green to olive to yellowish to brownish, streaked.
identification.stem: 5-18 cm, 1-2.5 cm thick, white, ring like skirt, volva at base.
identification.odor: Repugnant in age, sickeningly sweet, rotten honey, carrion.
identification.microscopicFeatures: Spores 7.5-13.5 × 5.5-10.5 µm, subglobose to ellipsoid, amyloid, no clamps.

note: One of the most poisonous, produces fairy rings, historical naming by Vaillant and Fries.
